name: Hydrophobinum
Relationship: Compare: XANTHIUM SPINOSUM - Cockle - (said to be specific for hydrophobia and is recommended for chronic cystitis in women). CANTH.; BELL.; STRAM.; LACH.; NAT-MUR.
Modalities: Worse: sight or sound of running water or pouring water
Worse: or even thinking of fluids; dazzling or reflected light; heat of sun; stooping

Head: Hypersensitiveness of all senses
Boring pain in forehead
Lyssophobia; fear of becoming made
Chronic headache
Emotion and bad news aggravate; also, thinking of fluids
Stool: Desire for stool on hearing or seeing running water
Constant desire to urinate on seeing running water
Profuse, watery stools, with pain in bowels; worse, evening
Mouth: Sore throat; constant desire to swallow, which is difficult,; gagging when swallowing water
Female: Uterine sensitiveness; conscious of womb  feels prolapsed

details: Affects principally the nervous system; aching in bones. Complaints from abnormal sexual desire. Convulsions brought on by dazzling light or sight of running water.
